subject: Cybersecurity
title: The Hacker Ethic: Principles of the First Generation
description: A 60-second lesson on The Hacker Ethic: Principles of the First Generation.

hook.text: Early hackers had an unwritten code: access to computers should be unlimited and total.

buildup.text: Steven Levy documented six principles: free access, decentralization, meritocracy, art in code, improvement, sharing.

discovery.text: The ethic said: judge hackers by what they build, not their credentials. Code quality equals status.

twist.text: This idealism clashed with reality as corporations locked down systems and criminalized exploration.

climax.text: The tension between open exploration and proprietary control still defines cybersecurity today.

punchline.text: The first rule of hacking was: share everything.
